alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:54PM EDT until July 15 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR MERCER...SOUTHERN MIDDLESEX AND SOUTHEASTERN BUCKS COUNTIES... At 552 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Sayreville to Ewing to Langhorn, moving east at 5 mph. This cluster of storms has a history of producing wind damage. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, North Brunswick, Ewing, Princeton, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Cranbury, Pennington, Yardley, Newtown, Tullytown, Langhorne, Ivyland, Brownville, Richboro, White Horse and Twin Rivers. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8 and 9. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 355 and 358. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 40. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 7. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 59 and 76. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
